Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Gaegurin-5 (Gaegurin 5; GGN5; Brevinin-1EMa; Frogs, amphibians, animals)
Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the frog skin active peptide family (Brevinin subfamily)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.7999137]Gram-positive bacteria:Micrococcus luteus (MIC=2.5 µg/ml), Staphylococcus epidermidis (MIC=10 µg/ml), Bacillus subtilis (MIC=10 µg/ml);Gram-negative bacteria:Klebsiella pneumoniae (MIC=50 µg/ml), Shigella dysentariae (MIC=50 µg/ml), Pseudomonas putida (MIC=50 µg/ml), Pseudomonas aeruginosa (MIC=100 µg/ml), Eshchericia coli (MIC=50 µg/ml);Fungi:Saccharomyces cerevisiae (MIC=50 µg/ml), Candida albicans (MIC=50 µg/ml), Salmonella typhimurium (MIC=200 µg/ml), Proteus mirabilis (MIC>200 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.7999137] It has 0.19% hemolytic activity at 0.1 μg/ml, 0.31% hemolytic activity at 1 μg/ml, 0.78% hemolytic activity at 10 μg/ml, 1.01% hemolytic activity at 100 μg/ml against human red blood cells
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Function: Has low hemolytic activity. Has a broad spectrum of activity against both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, fungi and protozoa. PTM

Literature.Title: Antimicrobial peptides from the skin of a Korean frog, Rana rugosa.
Literature.Author: Park JM, Jung JE, Lee BJ.
